review: I'm a little torn between giving Red Robin three stars or four, so I guess since I'm a generous person, I give them four.   We came in during lunch time on a Sunday.  It really wasn't busy at all.  Most of the people we saw there were workers.   We ordered our drinks first, a water with a lemon, a freckled lemonade for my daughter, and a chocolate milkshake for myself.  It took a while for our drinks to come to us, which was okay since the waiter was super nice.  We reminded him again, and they came right out to us.  The manager even gave us coupons for next time since we had to wait so long for our drinks!   For lunch, my husband and I share the mushroom burger with fries and my daughter ordered the mac and cheese.  The mushroom burger was really tasty!  The fries were good too, but I should have ordered the onion rings like I normally do.  They are way better! The atmosphere at Red Robin is fun and clean and it almost feels as if you are in an old diner!  I love to come to this place every once in a while.  The food isn't too bad, and the prices are pretty good too.

I like Red Robin because regardless of what city/state I'm in, they are always consistent and this place was no different!  Our waitress was Melissa who was ultra friendly, polite, and patient when the initial order of pretzel bites was swapped for jalapeno bites.  Back to consistency....the staff was polite, the service was fast, the bathrooms were clean, and the food was delicious!   Again Melissa was top notch!

The quality of both food and service is declining a bit.  At my last two visits, the burgers were smaller than I remembered. It's hit-or-miss whether the meat will be cooked as ordered; my burger was Medium (with a slightly pink center) as requested, but my wife's Medium-Rare was dark gray throughout.  I found my Coke was a bit watery; when a waiter finally came by again, he got me a slightly less watery one from another machine, but I noted that no one checked out the first machine to make sure no one else would get a disappointing drink. Up until sometime last year, burgers came in a handy paper wrapper in a basket, with a generous helping of fries. Now the burgers come on a plate, with very few fries, and the waitstaff probably won't offer more fries until you're ready to leave. I still like the variety of burgers available, and they're expanding the menu to emphasize a greater variety of foods. It also looks like they're trying to push liquor a little harder.

My family and I have been going to this location for quite some time. Tonight, I had the WORST and most DISGUSTING dining experience in this restaurant. We were seated at a dimly lit booth. My daughter ordered chicken fingers. After about 20 minutes, and eating half of her meal, she complained. I held her food under the light and looked closer at the chicken fingers. THEY WERE RAW. My daughter had consumed over a tender of purely RAW chicken. As I threw down the chicken I was holding in my hand, I had to stop myself from getting sick. The manager did not seemed phased and offered a measly 25% off our ticket. We left the rest of our food, paid the bill and left in a hurry. Never in my life have I been this disappointed as a consumer. It is one thing as an adult to get food poisoning, but now we are at home and my daughter is sick to her stomach. This restaurant has left a horrible impression. This was a family favorite, and we will not be back. As a family friendly restaurant, I CAUTION parents to steer clear. A family dinner shouldn't end this way and be detrimental to your child's health and overall well being. I wish I could add the disgusting pictures!

Tonight I was in the mood for a burger and a shake. So we went to Red Robin. I noticed immediately, service is slow. Not enough staff. The milk shakes are amazing. My son and I shared one and my husband had one to himself. Loved it. I ordered the prime chophouse burger and it was good. I only ate half. My husband finished mine and had the double burger. I don't remember what it was called. Anyways, the fries were good and hot but such a small portion. I don't 'want to sound like a pig, but if it's bottomless then it would be easier on them to give you more so you ask for less later. But anyways, my burger was good but not very hot. It was cooked but not hot. Like it had been sitting. After 2 burgers/fries, 2 shakes, a kid's meal we walked out paying $34 not including tip. 5 guys is better. I'll go back, but I won't be a regular.

Red Robin yum! Yum is correct, they have the best burgers for everyone. Chicken and beef burgers of your choice. They also have salads for people who do not like eating carbs. It is so good and their strawberry freckled lemonade is to die for, it's amazing!

I've been to this RR location several times in the past couple of years but the service I've had over the last 2 visits has been so terrible I just can't come back. Our visit a few weeks ago, after we were sat our waiter walked past us for almost 10 full minutes before coming over & saying, I guess no one is taking care of you guys so I'll just do it. The kitchen was backed up that night & we had a very long wait, the server apologized & brought out our food, meal by meal as it became ready. Tonight, again the service was just terrible. Our server brought out the adult drinks & we waited several more minutes for kids drinks. When they finally came he didn't have any straws & said he'd be back with some. We never got any. I finally gave my younger kids our straws & the older ones took their lids off. When our food came I'd ordered a bacon burger. It came with cheese which I didn't ask for (maybe it's that way on the menu but it's what I order every time & never get cheese). I also order my burger lettuce wrapped but they just sat it on the lettuce wedges instead of wrapping it in paper like is usually done. Again, I know this because I order the same thing every time & it's always wrapped in paper. My son got Mac & cheese & it had no spoon. The server who brought our food (different person) seemed annoyed & said I'll get you one. Shockingly, never returned. I just can't return to this location. I love RR so we'll go to other ones but I can't come back here unless I'm full up on patience & time. The wait time coupled with a staff who seem vacant, annoyed & unconcerned with costumer service is enough to make anyone reconsider.

The service was awesome today, by the waitress Tess.  She was sweet and smiley, got us everything we needed and wanted, and was great with my kids.   We ordered the porterhouse burger, Tavern burger pigged out, chicken wrap, kids Mac n Cheese, and kids burger with the royal treatment (bacon and egg).  All of us enjoyed our meal, ate a bunch of plates of never ending steak fries with different complimentary sauces!  That was fun to do with the kids.   They also had "shark week" on tv, which was to my daughters delight and made her while experience a top notch one.  We will definitely go back again!  We usually like hole-in-the-wall places, but this is one chain restaurant we will be returning to.

Can't figure out why this place has such a bad rating. It's my favorite sit-down burger place in town. The burgers are huge, the fries are endless, and everything is delicious smothered in the Red Robin seasoning. Also if you don't get the freckled lemonade, you're making a huge mistake. I love beer with my burgers but when I'm at RR I always get the freckled lemonade.

Red Robins is one of the only chains that I've gone to and they consistently have good food. Their burgers are delish... I love all thr variations of burgers and sandwhiches. Bottomless fries and speciality drinks. Service is usually pretty good as well.

Red Robin, YUUUUUUUUUM.  That about sums up my review of my experience at this Red Robin last weekend. My wife walked in and we were immediately seated.  We both decided to get water as our beverage.  I ordered the Fish and Chips and my wife ordered some Turkey sandwich. The Fish was hot, crispy on the outside, and a tad moist on the inside - perfect IMO.  The fries were just the right amount of crispiness and were delicious as always.  The tarter sauce that came with the fish was pretty good as well.  It was a tad pricey at $13.99 but after eating it, and taking some of it home to eat for another meal, it was worth the money. My wife and I were out here running some errands but I can definitely see us going back when we are at the Shadow Lake shopping area again.

Took a friend out for dessert for her birthday. Her cheesecake was delicious! I had Mud Pie which was ridiculously huge. For such a rich dessert, the portion size is crazy. Sometimes there aren't three people there to share it! It tasted good, but I wouldn't order it again due to the portion size. Our service was acceptable. The restroom had one stall with a toilet paper issue and another where the door would not latch.

I normally have a great experience here but that was not the case today. I had the bruschetta chicken which is one of my favorite entrees and today it tasted like someone seared the chicken on both sides with the grill then dropped it in the fryer. My girlfriend had a tasteless burger in addition to my not so pleasant meal. The service, however, was still awesome thanks to Josie.

I'm normally a big fan of Red Robin as a go-to option no matter where I travel and I need a burger. My biggest complaint is that their Endless Fries are really a myth these days. Here's how every visit goes lately: we sit, waitress takes drink order, before she leaves we ask for a basket of fries, she says the kitchen is busy (regardless of how many people are in the dining room), basket arrives 30 seconds after meal arrives (which this weekend equaled 30 minutes from ordering.) *sigh*

My family and I dined here for an early dinner tonight. There was a mishap with my salad and I told the waiter(I felt bad and I hate complaining but she assured me that it was no biggie and that she'd take care of it). I just wanted a new salad but she was so sweet and not only got me a new salad but she informed the owner(or manager...I couldn't really hear) and he personally visited our table and comped my meal. I wasn't expecting that at all! The service was excellent even before all this happened. We've eaten here many times before and will continue to do so. Everyone is very courteous.

I've been to Red Robin probably 5 times over the last 6 years and at three different locations.  My overall opinion is that the place just sells overpriced burgers with little justification for the pricing. For years my friends have made fun of my willingness to go to upscale gastropubs and taverns and order $12 hamburgers.  They were appalled at my willingness to spend so much on a such a basic entrée. I would try and explain that a hamburger patty made with ground ribeye instead of ground chuck, a house baked bun that wasn't a mass-market sesame seed bun, and topings like watercress instead of lettuce made for a great burger that totally justified the price.  However, Red Robin typically charges $10+ fpr many of their burgers and everyone seems to be okay with paying that much for a basic burger patty, with basic ingredients, from a chain restaurant.  Why would I go eat an average burger at Red Robin for $10 when for a dollar or two more I can go have a superb burger at any one of several upscale gastropubs? For me, one of the joys of French fries is that yummy ratio of fried crispy outer layer to soft steamy inside.  Steak fries just don't have a good ratio (too much of the latter and not enough of the former).  It's like someone cut a potato in half and called it fries.  I'm not surprised that they are "all you can eat" steak fries.  Since each fry is the equivalent of about an eighth of a potato, how many can any one person honestly eat?  Each small plate of fries they bring you is the equivalent of eating an entire potato. To mix it up, I tried substituting their Chili Chili™ Cheese Fries in place of their steak fried for a $3 up-charge. They were not good.  Chili is not good chili, overall texture of the dish is terrible.  Easily some of the worse chili cheese fries I've ever had.  Sonic Drive-In does a better job with chili cheese fries than Red Robin does. Service is friendly if not particularly attentive. This restaurant is clean and well-maintained.

Over priced burgers (their "specialty"), salads, and sandwiches that lack quality ingredients made by less than attentive cooks.  I ordered the fried chicken tender salad and in it I found a chunk of plastic mesh netting (like the ones used to bag bulk avocados or mandarins at the grocery store!) and several scattered extra crispy french fry remnants (nope, I didn't order fries with that!).  My husband's burger was one of their "new specials" with some fancy sauce (flavored ketchup) dumped on top - said he could find better at Sonic or Wendy's for half the price and twice the beefy construct.  And to top it off, apparently nobody knows how to (or doesn't want to) switch out the pop bags on their soda fountain because after complaining that my Sprite tasted like dirty water the waitress replaced it with a "fresh" one - which was still flat, dirty water.

Pro-tip:  Don't go out to lunch with the Twins on the first day of school when all of the Papillion school district has a half-day. The Good :  While it was obvious RR was swamped, our server did a great job of keeping our expectations realistic on food times and more importantly, when dining with young children getting the bottomless fries out and keeping their drinks filled.   The kids devoured their Mac and Cheese and Mini-Pizza.  I had the Genisys burger.  It was solid, I felt like there was a lot going on with the toppings but overall a tasty burger.   Outside of the wait for our food, this lunch date was a success.
I've been to this establishment a few times and always get great service, they have great drinks and burgers for the price are good. Endless fries are great as well as the sweet potato fries.

This is a nice enough location. It's clean and well-kept. The wait can be up to 30 minutes when it's busy. Lots of families, of course. There's a couple of arcade games for the kiddos while you wait. (Tip: There's a change machine so you can get quarters.) There's also a kiosk at each table with additional (free) games. The tables are close together, but not too close. The service was a bit lacking, but they were very busy. We weren't checked on and missed the opportunity to order more items. And it felt a bit rushed. The beer list is very meh. We're talking like only 4 beers and they were all crappy ones. They do have a nice selection of lemonades and milkshakes. The kids menu has plenty of options. The regular menu has a whole bunch of options. I appreciated the multitude of dipping sauces. The onion rings were tasty. The poutine fries were decent. The nacho tavern burger was alright. It lacked flavor. For a chain restaurant, it's a-ok. But there are definitely better burgers to be had.

I'm giving this place ONE STAR on cleanliness.  The original table we were seated at was filthy and extremely sticky everywhere.  When we moved to another table, the entire counter along where we sat seemed like it hadn't been wiped down in over a week. It's  pretty disgusting eating in a completely dusty area that doesn't look like it's been cleaned in a while.  Server was kind, sweet and attentive. Food was ALRIGHT (garden burger seemed to not be cooked thoroughly)   Overall it was fine.. Not great. I would recommend them cleaning more and cleaning everything.

Will never be back. $14.50 for a Black and Blue burger that can be had elsewhere for half that. Ordered without the onions, and of course it arrived with onions. Kids fries felt and tasted as if they were cooked hours ago. The apple slices with one of the kids meals were brown and soft. Sunday evening at 6pm and the place is 1/8 full. I see bankruptcy in the future for RR!

Since the remodel they removed the arcade games and crammed as many tables against each other as possible and yet the wait time is still pretty lengthy. There is not enough room to breath in this place anymore.

Always great food, good beer and a nice staff. I always forget how much this place costs though. Feeing my family of 4 easily gets to $60-70. I'm a pretty big fan of the Burning Love and Ghost burgers which aren't really that hot, they're just good. They just redecorated recently too which adds to the atmosphere.

Our burgers were good, but my sweet potatoe fries were cold. My husbands fries were hot. We then ordered a refill on both fries and we waited 23 minutes. They were a little busy but it was 7:05. The waiter had time to do some messing around while clearing the tables.
I always have a great time here and the servers are always upbeat. Food is good and not over priced. I love you can order on the touch screens.

I always enjoy this place. Great selection of burgers but are a bit pricey. Servers are very upbeat and fun. The auto checkout computer is great when it works. Hint: when you have problems with the computer, take it off the table, don't hope it will somehow work for the next customer.

Excellent meal and service. We were there for a late lunch on a Monday.  Service was fast and attentive. We sat in the bar area. Ordered a fruit smoothie which was good but not amazing. I had the tavern Mac n cheese which was tasty and came with a small side salad. Husband had the red robin burger which has the fried egg on it and he said it was excellent.  He ordered a salted caramel shake and it was phenomenal!  Definitely taste the salt with it and was fantastic.  Like this chain but have had hit and miss around the country. This was a good one.

I really love burgers, and I know that means I should try be putting people onto non chain burger joints but I have never been to any of the local places that can consistently deliver a great burger like Red Robin can. The Tavern Double is literally what I picture when someone ask me what a perfect burger is. Their staff also knocks it out ever time.

Don't get the pub mac and cheese!  Stick to burgers, red robin, or serve that mac and cheese as a side. I expect warm, melty, stick to your ribs food when I order a pub mac and cheese. I got a cereal bowl of noodles that were cooked well enough with a flavorless white cheese sauce, then a slice of what looked like kraft singles melted on top.  The crutons and bacon were tasty, didn't mind paying for thr bacon because it was the only part with flavor.  VERY disappointing.  Least the Guiness shake was still tasty as ever, tho smaller than the last time I had it...

Rude management and multiple times we ran out of drinks and our waitress walked right by.  When speaking to the manager about our pleasant experiences in the past he said that hasn't been recent- sorry but yes it has thanks for calling me a liar though. Used to like this place, unfortunately we don't come back.
Been a few years since we have been to the Red Robin. We got right in and was seated in a booth. Hamburgers were big and juicy and we love their fries. It was a nice visit. Thank you

This was my first time ever coming here! My sister and I came for a late lunch and it was definitely a cool experience. Our server Emily was high energy and had us laughing the entire time. She took our drink out and they were at the table in the blink of an eye. I ordered the Banzai burger which is a teriyaki burger with pineapple, cheddar, lettuce, tomato, and mayo.. I had mine sans tomato and mayo. I also had an Oreo milkshake and my goodness was that delicious! I'm tempted to go back today just to get one.. it was thick and I like milkshakes that you have to work for. Anywho, as I'm still drooling over this milkshake, back to the food.. Red Robin is known for their bottomless fries and everything delivered! Food came out quick, taste was there and on top of a cool server this experience was great! Come on Tuesday's for military discounts as well! I'm getting my milkshake today for sure though! Haha!

For burger lovers like myself, Red Robin falls into a revolving selection of good burger establishments.  Red Robin offers casual seating and is great for children!  The restaurant offers other types of food, but it's a burger chain and that's where the quality is at!  The restaurant has a selection of classic burgers that doesn't change, and features beef and chicken varieties.  My favorites include the Royal Red Robin burger (burger with a fried egg on it), the Whiskey River BBQ burger (barbeque and onion straws), and the Bonzai burger (teriyaki and grilled pineapple).  The restaurant also has an extensive selection of appetizers.  Within the last couple years, Red Robin introduced the Tavern Double lineup.  They are smaller double cheeseburgers available in a variety of flavors.  You can make them larger for an upcharge.  They have varieties such as Sriracha, Macaroni and Cheese, and others.  But the best part about Red Robin is the bottomless steak fries.  Pair them with the licensed Red Robin seasoning and dip them in ranch and they can't be beat!!! The atmosphere is welcoming, with comfortable seating, TV's, and more!  The prices are reasonable, somewhat on the high side in my opinion.  I took my 3 year old son to late lunch and our tab was $23 after tax and tip.  My family of 6 eats for closer to $50-$55. Red Robin does have a rewards club which is a great value.  Buy 9 burgers and your 10th is free.  You always get a BOGO burger on your birthday

Went there for dinner last night. After no service at another restaurant. We had excellent service here. Food was great, waitress was great. Wish would would have went here to begin with. Our waitress was Julianna M. She was great! She even made our daughters birthday special. I would recommend this restaurant!

Red Robin. What to say about Red Robin. I have been eating here since I was in high school (15 years ago). Hamburgers are still big and juicy as they have always been; and I do like their new tavern burger menu. The prices have gone up, and the tavern burger menu is what hamburgers should cost. This facility always is kept clean and presentable. The servers are attentive, and paying is easy. You can pay right at the table on the ipad-screen-stand-computer-thing. Never paid at one where it wasn't out of receipt paper, but still convenient.

I live right in the neighborhood so this has become a pretty common stop for me with the kiddos. Most of the time we get awesome servers. You can't help that occasionally you get a teen who doesn't want to be there. The food is consistent. Unlimited fries are the coolest. Their poppy seed honey mustard is TO DIE FOR!!!   They have gluten free and any other weird health conscious thing you want. The rewards system is So-So but worth it for the occasional free or half off burger.  They have chalk boards for the kids to play with at the table if the crayons and menu are boring.   Lots of options for the kids menu too. My lil princess loves the meatball lollipops.  The burger menu changes enough so you can try a new fangled burger with some inane topping like mac n cheese or waffles or Scooby snacks or whatever is popular. But the standard Burgers are yummy. The fried shrimp are pretty damn good too.  Oh, last thing. I'm not a fan of the mixed drinks but I like a heavy pour. Most chains don't do a heavy pour. No biggie. They do a large glass of wine and that's the bees knees for me. They have lots of beers too. And desserts. It's all good. It's a chain but a good chain.

Ordered online and swung by about 15 minutes later. The host greeted us and directed us to the bar for pick up. Emily was great! She was very friendly and was able to find our order quickly. She went over I with us and confirmed everything was correct. She asked if we needed anything else and then gave us a thank you and wished us a great rest of the day. Love it when we feel appreciated! Keep up the great job Emily!!!
This is my favorite place for onion rings, I love it. I like the sauces they serve. Aioli is the best. I am not fond of sandwiches. Service is good. I like the ambience.

Review of their take out:  I thought their To Go process was really easy. Some places are such a pain to order from and the woman who took our order was great, easy to understand and nailed our order. She also did a great job of estimating the time that it would be ready and was very thorough. It was ready with all the bells and whistles when we came to pick it up, no wait at all! All packaged very neatly as well!
